snippet: The debate surrounding the idea of eliminating the kickoff is a microcosm of a broader question: when is the way the game is played altered so drastically that it is no longer the same game?
abstract: NFL is considering removing kickoffs, which have highest rate of injury of any play; Arizona Cardinals kicker Jay Feely says removing kickoffs would alter the integrity of the game, because they play such an integral part in establishing field position; suggests restricting size of players who could stay back to block for returns.
lead_paragraph: The debate surrounding the idea of eliminating the kickoff is a microcosm of a broader question: when is the way the game is played altered so drastically that it is no longer the same game?

headline.seo: Tradition vs. Player Safety in N.F.L. Kickoff Debate
headline.main: ‘Train Wreck of a Play’ Collides With Consciences
headline.print_headline: ‘Train Wreck of a Play’ Collides With Consciences
